content.description: This is a very challenging sloper problem with an awkward crux mantle. Start low on the sloping lip and make hard moves up and right to poor slopers and figure out how to top this sucker out. Better than it looks and is a fight the entire way.
content.location: 20 feet past Pretty Bloc Swag by the water.

content.description: Sit start matched on a large crescent-shaped sloping rail. Pull on and make a hard move out right to another large sloping rail. From here compress up the two large rails before making a long reach up to an interesting lip encounter. Friendly and bullet-proof rock.
content.protection: 2 pads and a spotter. The landing is quite scary, but the movement of the problem climbs away from the drop.
content.location: This boulder problem is located on the same boulder as "Leave It to Beaver". From "Leave It to Beaver" step up past the stump and up the ravine. After a little bit of high stepping up a tiered approach, you reach a semi-flat landing with this problem above it. The rail features are quite visible.

content.description:
A new contender for Pawtuckaway's best problem.  FA'd by Hayden Miller on 12/16/2011. 

  From Hayden's description on sendage.com:   "Start matched on left slopper rail. Move up through gastons and crimps to arete then compress your way to the lip. Exit left." 

  I will add that (as someone who has many years of improvement ahead to even have a hope of doing this climb) it looks like an absolute instant classic. 

  Note: The 4-star rating of this route is passed along from Hayden's sendage.com report, where he suggest 5 stars - the maximum possible on sendage.
content.protection: Multiple pads and spotters.  This is tall and is not a gimme at the top.
content.location: From Leave It To Beaver continue just to the right around the corner (if the water is frozen you can walk right around the boulder, otherwise you'll need to do some scrambling).

content.description: Start sitting on the right side of the boulder with a hanging, blocky arete to your left. Heel hooks and tension get you to a pinch and a sharp crimp. From here, make a big move and lots more tension lead to a slopey but solid topout.
content.protection: A couple of pads will help cover the rock in the middle of the landing. A spotter to keep you from tipping backwards into the swamp isn't a bad idea.
content.location: In Devil's Den, head past the Up In Smoke Boulder and follow the trail towards the swampy pond. It will head down and right. At the bottom of that dip, take a left. The problem is on the water-facing side of a boulder right by the pond's edge.

content.description: A fun and powerful problem! Stand start with both hands above the roof. There is a unique left hand mini pinch and a nothing sloper for your right hand. Compress the holds and figure out some foot beta. Move up right hand to a good crimp/ pinch feature and then fire up left hand to a side-pull crimp. From here get established on the slab and top out with good holds. Aesthetic and proud!
content.location: From Leaver It To Beaver look to the right of the Beaver start hold. This is the obvious 45 degree roof 10 feet away.

content.description: Sit start the bottomless arete underneath the prow. Get a high heel hook and grab some good crimps. Power your way off the ground and choose your next hold. Make your way up and right utilizing the smooth unique rock of the problem. Use some fancy footwork or power your way up the arete and then top out on the slab with care.
content.location: From "Leave It To Beaver", walks towards "Pretty Block Swag" and this problem will meet you in the middle.

content.description: This area has some unique problems in a great, secluded area located adjacent to a placid pond.
